summary:
Guadeloupe is a group of islands in the Caribbean that belongs to France. It includes six main islands and many smaller ones. The capital is Basse-Terre, but the most populated city is Les Abymes. In 2024, around 395,000 people lived there. The islands were named by Christopher Columbus in 1493.

French is the official language, but many people also speak a local creole. It was once part of the Schengen Area, but now only follows some of its rules. Guadeloupe used to include Saint Barth√©lemy and Saint Martin, but they became separate territories in 2007.
title: Guadeloupe
